definition:
Given an integer $n$, count how many integers $m$ in the set
$\{n + 1, n + 2, \ldots n^2\}$ satisfy $\phi(m) = n$. This is the
[*totient valence*]{} of $n$, usually labelled $N_{\phi}(n)$. (The only
two special cases are 2 and 6, for which one has to look a little
beyound $n^2$).

Robert Carmichael conjectured that $N_{\phi}(n) = 1$ never. Two
sequences in Sloane’s OEIS that list numbers with higher totient
valences than preceding numbers are A007374 and A097942.
